intro: Lepidium simile, commonly known as field cress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in racemes, and its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often hairy. It produces small, round pods containing several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Lepidium simile is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been naturalized in various regions around the world.
